reviews.text: We arrived at the hostal at ~2am. It's very hard to identify from the street and looks somewhat dark and uninhabited, but don't be fooled. This is much nicer than your typical "hostal" - excellent full bath, a/c, tv, etc. We were so pleasantly surprised. Maria was a wealth of information and such a great resource in planning our activities while in Madrid.
reviews.title: A Great Place

likes.disliked: — Leaving key at front desk everytime you leave the hostal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent 6 nights in June at the Hostal Barrera, and found it to be excellent value for the money (45 euros per night for a single). I love to walk, and the convenience to the metro, the Atocha train station, and the big 3 museums (Prado, Thyssen-Bornemisza, and Renia Sofia) is a huge plus. Note that it wouldn't be good for the handicapped, because the street is somewhat sloping. The immediate neighborhood isn't super trendy, and generally I found more hip bars and restaurants elsewhere, but there were some local places to eat at reasonable prices. As other reviewers have mentioned, the family that runs the hostal is super helpful, like explaining to me exactly how to find the bus station going to Segovia, or arranging a taxi to the airport for me at 5 am. My room was a single, and thus small, but it was very clean, particularly the bathroom which had new fixtures. Air conditioning worked well. I could hear a bit of noise from the other guests-- it wasn't bad, particularly by spanish standards, but it isn't soundproofed or anything. The hostal is on busy street, but most of the rooms overlook a side street and I couldn't hear the traffic noise unless someone honked their horn. Overall, it wasn't the ritz, but I could never afford to stay at the ritz anyway! When assessing value for the money, the Barrera ranks a 5.
reviews.title: Three time's the charm

reviews.text: stayed 2 nights to see madrid football game . Hotel in central location but slightly seedy location close to metro stop. Room ok for price and bed comfortable though pillows terrible Reception friendly though restaurant suggestions erratic. We booked an inside room as street noise a problem in Madrid so quiet apart from doors slamming from late night revellers . Would use again at this price level. Bathroom small but other rooms had bigger ones. Finally would concur with comments on metro pickpockets as my wallet stolen . Suggest you dont carry wallet
reviews.title: ok for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this place because of the raving reviews on this site.
reviews.title: Sleepless in Madrid.....
great place, just a bit noisy on the street side
reviews.text: The night was a "symphony" of constant noise from the street, with every noise several neighboring rooms had to offer: I even heard people in different rooms caugh- and I heard everyone's alarm clocks!
The next morning I checked out. Since I originally booked 5 nights, I had to pay for 2 nights even though I only stayed one night- but it was worth it just to move out!
reviews.title: Set the bar for hostels

reviews.text: Note also that while the location is not very far from the center,- there are far better locations at similar prices not to mention quality- such as the hotel I moved into after checking out from this one.
reviews.title: A+++ Charming, Great Location, Amazing Value

reviews.text: After my husband and I visited Madrid in March , I returned with my sister-in-law to visit this wonderful city. I chose the Hostel Barrerra again and was not dissapointed.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: We shared a twin room and found this room also to be clean, fairly spacious and quiet. Obviously when we opened the window some noise could be heard, but then again the hotel is situated in just about the best location in Madrid, so the street outside does get busy.
reviews.title: Convenient and good value for budget travelers in Madrid

reviews.text: My sister in law was amazed that this hotel costs so little but offers a safe, clean and friendly environment in a capital city.
reviews.title: Must stay hotel

reviews.text: If cleanliness is top of your list of priorities then this is the place for you. Spotless; couldn`t fault it and the staff were friendly and efficient. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but well laid out and everything seemed quite new. Big negative was the noise. Relentless traffic all night; there may be some rooms further down the side street which might be quieter, not sure. The workmen clattering and banging upstairs from 8am until 11pm on a couple of days were another distraction. The location was handy for the three galleries and an enjoyable (but not short) walk to the city centre (Sol). Having seen the area described in another review as `seedy` I would say that was a bit of an exaggeration; I`d say it was more down-at-heel and we never felt unsafe walking back at night. There is a `Sex Center` a few doors down, but apart from the name on the front it`s quite discreet though be prepared for the kids asking what a peepshow is!
reviews.title: Nice but noisy

reviews.text: Great location. Excellent staff. Small rooms but it is a hostal. Very clean. Ideal for those on a budget. Can't fault it and would go back.
reviews.title: Great value
Fantastic!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two months in November 07 and we loved the place. We were early for check-in, so they held our luggage and gave us a quick list of things to do (and places to eat) until the room is ready. The room was incredible. They told us it was renovated 5 years ago, but I could have sworn they did it a week ago. All brand new modern (think IKEA-like) furniture, flat screen TV, immaculate bathroom. You have to turn in the key when you leave the room, and then pick it up when you return. That involves ringing the buzzer so they let you in the building and climbing a set of stairs to the reception room. We encountered 3 receptionists throughout our stay and they were all exceptionally friendly.

This is a great place for not very much money at a great location in the city. We took the metro to it from the airport to save money. We had to take a taxi back to the airport because it was too early in the morning and that cost us about 30 euro.
reviews.title: great location and value

description: Hostal Barrera is cozy hostal, offering newly refurbished rooms en-suite, FREE WI-FI,LCD tv, central heating and air conditoning .... and unbeatable rates.Ideal location in the city center of Madrid, just a walking distance of the main museums and attractions in town, and also to the main train station, Atocha Rail Way Station, to get to cities such as Seville,Barcelona, Toledo, Córdoba, Valencia ... We speak english, french, italian.
